articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: The Palestinian Islamist group Hamas said on Wednesday it would not take part in a new round of Gaza ceasefire talks slated for Thursday in Qatar, dimming hopes for a negotiated truce that Iranian sources say could hold back an Iranian attack on Israel.
articles.title: Hamas to stay out of Gaza truce talks, Iran considers Israel attack

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The World Health Organization on Wednesday declared mpox a global public health emergency for the second time in two years, following an outbreak of the viral infection in the Democratic Republic of Congo that has spread to neighbouring countries.
articles.title: WHO declares mpox a global public health emergency for second time in two years

articles.author: Gram Slattery, Jonathan Drake
articles.description: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump lobbed a series of personal and policy-based attacks at his Democratic rival Kamala Harris in a speech on Wednesday, hoping to recover from a difficult stretch during which his lead in opinion polls has all but evaporated.
articles.title: Trump attacks Harris policies - and persona - as allies push for messaging shift

articles.author: Panu Wongcha-Um
articles.description: The biggest party in Thailand's caretaker government will meet on Thursday to choose a successor for dismissed former premier Srettha Thavisin, as it races to shore up its alliance a day ahead of a pivotal parliamentary vote on a new prime minister.
articles.title: Thailand's Pheu Thai party to decide PM candidate as parliamentary vote looms

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Columbia University President Minouche Shafik said she resigned on Wednesday, nearly four months after overseeing the university's handling of campus protests over Israel's war in Gaza.
articles.title: Columbia University president quits, months after handling of Gaza war protests

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Authorities investigating the Brazilian plane crash that killed all 62 on board last week now have the full transcript of the "black box" but its content did not immediately explain the cause of the accident, local TV station Globo said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Black box shows Brazil plane crashed 1 minute after pilots sensed trouble, local media says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Authorities in Russia's Kursk region have decided to evacuate the population of its Glushkov district, acting governor Alexei Smirnov said late on Wednesday, amid the continued advance of Ukrainian forces into the border region.
articles.title: Russia to evacuate thousands more from Kursk region attacked by Ukraine

articles.author: Yury Garcia
articles.description: Ecuador's government said in a statement on Wednesday that a request by Vice President Veronica Abad that the country's electoral court remove President Daniel Noboa from his post is an attempt at a "coup".
articles.title: Ecuador says vice president's request that court remove Noboa is a "coup"

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol offered on Thursday to establish a working-level consultative body with North Korea to discuss ways to ease tension and resume economic cooperation, as he laid out his vision on unification of the neighbours.
articles.title: South Korea's Yoon offers working-level talks with North Korea

articles.author: Tim Kelly
articles.description: Japan marked the anniversary on Thursday of its defeat in World War Two with visits by at least three cabinet ministers to the controversial Yasukuni shrine that other Asian nations see as a symbol of the country's wartime aggression.
articles.title: Japan ministers visit controversial war shrine on World War Two anniversary
